it.unitn.ing.rista.diffr
Class Atom

java.lang.Object
  it.unitn.ing.rista.interfaces.BaseFactoryObject
      it.unitn.ing.rista.diffr.XRDcat
          it.unitn.ing.rista.diffr.Atom
All Implemented Interfaces:
basicObj, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Atom
extends XRDcat

The Atom is a class that implements an atom and perform all the task the atom need to do, store scattering factors and coordinates. Each atom belong to a Phase. See the atominfo.cif for all atom (and symbols) recognized by Maud and their default values. There is a copy in the database and preferences files folder created by Maud at the first run. See also the AtomInfo class responsible of loading the atomic tables from atominfo.cif (either the one in the files.jar archive by default or the alternate one in the user files preferences and databases folder of Maud based on the specific preference). For some properties multiple tables exist in the file, but only one is loaded.

Since:
JDK1.1
See Also:
AtomInfo, Phase

public int setField(java.lang.String cif,

                    java.lang.String max,
                    boolean free,
                    java.lang.String refName,
                    java.lang.String refBound,
                    java.lang.String constant,
                    java.lang.String ratio)
Overwrite the setField of XRDcat; necessary because we need to check the atom symbol for consistency with the Maud convention. So in case the field is the atom symbol the check is performed. In any case the setField() method of XRDcat is performed.

Overrides:

notifyParameterChanged

public void notifyParameterChanged(Parameter source)
Executed when a Parameter of this object is changed. Overwrite the same method in XRDcat. In this case add to the message that an atom position has changed flag if it is the case.

Overrides:
notifyParameterChanged in class XRDcat

getAtomSymbol

public java.lang.String getAtomSymbol()
Use this to get the actual complete symbol of this atom in Maud convention. E.g. AG2+ etc.

Returns:
the atom symbol

setAtomSymbol

public void setAtomSymbol(java.lang.String alabel)
Set the atom symbol. It is then used to retrieve all the atom characteristics, from scattering factors to weight, absorption etc. The Maud convention is as in the following examples: AG2+, AG, H, O2- but the method can accept also different format as the symbol will be correctly converted. Other format accepted: Ag2+, ag+2, Ag, h, O-2

Parameters:
alabel - the symbol to be set

getAtomRadius

public double getAtomRadius()
Return the radius of this atom in Angstrom

Returns:
the actual radius of the atom

Parameters:
rad - the radius to be set

checkOxidationNumber

public static java.lang.String checkOxidationNumber(java.lang.String symbol)
Check the oxidation number in the symbol for correctness. In particular if the -/+ sign is before or after the oxidation number and return the atom label with the oxidation in the correct Maud convention (at the moment Maud uses the sign after the number).

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol to be checked
Returns:
the symbol with the corrected Maud convention for oxidation

checkUpperLowerCase

public static java.lang.String checkUpperLowerCase(java.lang.String symbol)
Check the atom symbol for correctness of the upper-lowercase letters. Maud prefers the symbol with all uppercase letters.

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol to be checked
Returns:
the symbol with the corrected Maud convention for upper-lowercase letters

checkAtomSymbol

public static java.lang.String checkAtomSymbol(java.lang.String symbol)

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol to be checked
Returns:
the recognized atom symbol

getSiteLabel

public java.lang.String getSiteLabel()
The site label is a conventional string to identify a certain site occupied by a certain atom. It just a string assigned by the user. Conventionally the atom symbol followed by a progressive number (for more sites with the same atom) should be used.

Returns:
the site label

getAnisoBfactor

public Parameter getAnisoBfactor(int index)
Gets the anisotropic B factor Parameter corresponding to the index passed. The index goes from 0 for the first (B11) parameter to 5 for the last one (B12). They are in the following order: B11 B22 B33 B23 B13 B12

Parameters:
index - the number of the anisotropic B factor to be retrieved.
Returns:
the anisotropic B factor Parameter corresponding to index.

getAnisoBfactorValue

public double getAnisoBfactorValue(int index)
Gets the anisotropic B factor number value corresponding to the index passed. The index goes from 0 for the first (B11) parameter to 5 for the last one (B12). They are in the following order: B11 B22 B33 B23 B13 B12

Parameters:
index - the number of the anisotropic B factor to be retrieved.
Returns:
the anisotropic B factor cached number value corresponding to index.

computeCartesianCoords

protected void computeCartesianCoords(boolean entireCell)
Calculates real cartesian coordinates from fractional coordinates for use in force field computation and structure visualization. The cartesian coordinates are stored in the cartesianCoords field. All equivalent positions included.

getCartesianCoords

public java.util.ArrayList getCartesianCoords(boolean entireCell)
Gets an ArrayList containing all the cartesian coordinates for cell plotting purpose. All equivalent positions included. If the entire cell is required it computes all the atoms positions comprised in the cell from min to max in fractional coordinates where min and max are retrieved from the two Maud preferences: cellPlotting.lowerFractionalCoordinate cellPlotting.higherFractionalCoordinate Default values for min, max are -0.05 and 1.05

Parameters:
entireCell - true if the entire cell is needed, false if only the repeated cell unit is required.
Returns:
the list of cartesion coordinates. Each atomic position inside the list is stored as a Coordinates object.

getPhaseParent

protected Phase getPhaseParent()
Gets the Phase to which this atom belong.

Returns:
the Phase parent of this atom.

public void turnPositionForward()

turnPositionBackward

public void turnPositionBackward()

refreshPositions

public void refreshPositions()
Refresh the array atomcoordinates with all the equivalent position coordinates computed from the atom coordinated and the equivalent positions given by the space group. Each entry in the array is an object of the class Coordinates. Also the array of cartesian coordinates is refreshed.

refreshPositions

public void refreshPositions(double dx,
                             double dy,
                             double dz)
Refresh all equivalent positions based on the dx, dy, dz coordinates of one generator.

Parameters:
dx - x fractional coordinate of the generator position
dy - y fractional coordinate of the generator position
dz - z fractional coordinate of the generator position

collapsePositions

public void collapsePositions()
Compute positions (call the refreshPositions() method) and check for equivalent positions too close. If too close it collapse them in a more symmetric position and changes the coordinates of this atom for this new position. It also compute the new occupation value mantaining the same quantity.

transformAbsoluteCoordToLocal

public void transformAbsoluteCoordToLocal(Coordinates coordFirst)

transformLocalCoordToAbsolute

public void transformLocalCoordToAbsolute(Coordinates coord)

transformLocalCoordToAbsolute

refreshOccupancyAndQuantity

public void refreshOccupancyAndQuantity()
Refresh the occupancy and quantity of this atom. Based on the setting inside the parent Phase (using quantityFromOccupancy() method) it computes the quantity from occupancy or the occupancy from the quantity.

computeOccupancyFromQuantity

public void computeOccupancyFromQuantity()
Compute the occupancy value from the quantity using the number of equivalent positions (getSiteMultiplicity()).

computeQuantityFromOccupancy

public void computeQuantityFromOccupancy()
Compute the quantity value from the occupancy using the number of equivalent positions (getSiteMultiplicity()).

public void checkSmallerCoordinates()

tooShortDistance

public boolean tooShortDistance(Coordinates coordFirst,
                                Coordinates coordNext)
Check if the distance between two coordinates positions is smaller than one atomic radius of this atom.

Parameters:
coordFirst - object containing the fractional coordinates of the first atom
coordNext - object containing the fractional coordinates of the second atom
Returns:
true if the distance is smaller

tooShortDistance

public boolean tooShortDistance(Coordinates coordFirst,
                                Coordinates coordNext,
                                double distanceToCheck)
Check if the distance between two coordinates positions is smaller than a certain distance passed to the method.

Parameters:
coordFirst - object containing the fractional coordinates of the first atom
coordNext - object containing the fractional coordinates of the second atom
distanceToCheck - the distance for the checking.
Returns:
true if the distance between the two positions is shorter than distanceToCheck.

                     Coordinates coordNext,
                     int wt2)
Collapse the position of two atoms into one and compute the new mean position returned in the Coordinates object of the first position. The new mean position is computed weighting the two position respect to their weight.

Parameters:
coordFirst - coordinates of the first position, the collapsed final position will be returned in this object
wt1 - weight of the first position
coordNext - coordinates of the second position
wt2 - weight of the second position

the site multeplicity.
